text.p: Microsoft Corp is expected to report second quarter earnings after the stock market closes on Friday, and traders said they were hearing "whisper" numbers on Wall Street of $0.53 to $0.55 a share.
"Whisper" figures are increasingly emerging among traders in the run-up to technology companies' earnings reports. The numbers are often higher than forecasts published by First Call.
According to First Call, analysts' consensus estimate for Microsoft's fiscal second quarter is $0.51 a share, up from $0.44 a year ago.
According to First Call, the highest estimate is $0.55 a share.
"I've heard whisper numbers of $0.53 to $0.55," said Phil Orlando, chief investment officer at ValueLine's Asset Management Division.
"I'd be real surprised" if Microsoft's earnings merely matched the First Call consensus of $0.51 a share, he said.
Another technology stock trader said he had heard whisper numbers of around $0.52-$0.53 a share, but going a high as $0.55.
